Curator's comments: Bernand cites Ricci as saying that the stone is in the British Museum, but there is no evidence for this; Ricci's remark must be an error. However Bernand cites measurements which he seems to have acquired from notes by Ricci; he also notes two cuttings on the top and two large cuttings underneath; from this the inference is drawn that it is the base for a statuette. The pieces is discussed and further literature is given in William Horbury and David Noy, Jewish Inscriptions of Graeco-Roman Egypt (Cambridge University Press, 1992), pp. 42-44, no. 26.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (68, 15 and pl. XXII, no. 15)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (759-60, no. 28)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (BA.22)
